SEARCH
Package com.dreamwork.authentication

Class AuthenticationService

java.lang.Object
com.dreamwork.authentication.AuthenticationService
@Service public class AuthenticationService extends Object
Service for handling authentication-related tasks such as retrieving the current authenticated user and logging out the user.

This service retrieves user details based on the username of the authenticated user and manages user context.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description
    AuthenticationService(CandidateRepository candidateRepository, RecruiterRepository recruiterRepository)
    Constructor with the specified repositories for managing candidates and recruiters.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthenticationService

      @Autowired public AuthenticationService(CandidateRepository candidateRepository, RecruiterRepository recruiterRepository)
      Constructor with the specified repositories for managing candidates and recruiters.
      Parameters:
      candidateRepository - the repository for accessing candidate data.
      recruiterRepository - the repository for accessing recruiter data.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentUser

      public User getCurrentUser()
      Retrieves the current authenticated user (Candidate or Recruiter) based on the username stored in the security context.
      Returns:
      the User object representing the currently authenticated user.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if no user with the current username is found in the repositories.

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user by clearing the security context and invalidating the HTTP session. This method ensures that the user's authentication details are removed from the context and that their session is properly invalidated to prevent any further access without re-authentication.
